DOC.brief_summary: Cataract cloud lens eye , initially prevents clear vision eventually progress blindness leave untreated . Cataract remain leading cause blindness important cause visual impairment across globe . Cataract surgery ultrasonic phacoemulsification common surgery practice France ( 600 000/year ) Two sub-categories phacoemulsification coexist : Endocapsulars technique represent Divide-and-Conquer Phaco-Chop ; Supracapsular technique mainly represent Subluxation ( similar Tilt-and-Tumble ) The corneal endothelium play important role maintaining dehydrate state transparency cornea . Some degree endothelial cell loss invariably occur type cataract surgery amount endothelial cell loss may vary type surgical technique The aim study evaluate density central corneal endothelial cell cataract surgery compare two phacoemulsification technique ( Divide-and-Conquer v Subluxation )
DOC.brief_title: Endothelial Cell Loss After Phacoemulsification Intra Supracapsular
DOC.criteria: Male female age ≥ 18 year Patients undergoing cataract surgery Visual acuity Monoyer scale < 6/10e ( < +0.2 logMar ) Nuclear , cortical posterior subcapsular cataract normal density severe LOCSIII classification insulindependent diabetes /or diabetic retinopathy corneal disease : keratitis , dystrophy , corneal degeneration Any disease intraocular pressure Any disease anterior segment Low preoperative endothelial cell density < 1500 c/mm² Combined surgery ( cataract + corneal transplant , cataract + glaucoma surgery , cataract +vitrectomy ... ) Risk factor surgical peroperative complication Pregnancy , lactation Ward court Patient cover Social Security scheme
